td.content: 4.6 x 5.1 x 4.6 cm mass in the aortopulmonary window encasing the left pulmonary artery, a 1.9-cm subcarinal lymph node, and a mass in the left upper lobe of the lung measuring 2.5 x 2.1 cm with suspicious regional lymphangitic spread
shows 2 enhancing cerebral metastases of lung cancer in the left cerebral hemisphere

td.content: s:pt presents with critical posterior thoracic pain on respiration, severe right shoulder pain. he has history of severe dyspnea. he is a 44 year old white M. o:Height 76 in, Weight 120 lbs, Temperature 99.1 F, Pulse 77, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 17 a:Lung Cancer p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed cisplatin - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, irinotecan - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, and ordered lung transplant - lung.
